meta.disclaimer: This chatbot provides educational information, not medical advice.

response: Hi there! I'm here to help with any questions you may have about menstrual pain. You can ask me anything, whether its about cramps, back pain, or headaches, and I'll provide some helpful advice!

response: Period headaches are common types of migraine that occur around the time of your menstrual cycle. Hormonal changes usually cause these migraines, and they may get worse with movement, light, smells, or sounds. These symptoms can range from a few hours to multiple days. If these symptoms align with what you are experiencing, sleeping in a quiet room without any bright lights or strong odors may relieve symptoms. Also, eating meals to prevent your stomach from being empty may also help. If the headaches are more severe, they are typically called menstrual migraines. 60% of people who experience menstruation experience hormonal migraines around their period.
